Text:
Our recent#LevyingUpreport found that the current apprenticeship system is not working for all businesses. 

Ahead of the#Budget, we're calling on the Chancellor to listen to employers and reform the levy so that it's fit for the future.

Five years ago,#FlexforSuccessrevealed that 92% of employers wanted more flexibility in their levy spending. Our recent#LevyingUpreport identified a similar call, yet no change has been made.

Here are the#FlexForSuccessrecommendations we still want to see become a reality.

At City & Guilds, we believe that the race to#netzerowill only be won when people have the right training and skills. 

We're committed to equip the workforce to transition to the low carbon economy.Learn more:https://cityandguilds.com/what-we-offer/green-skills-and-sustainability…(2/2)

Today we launch#LevyingUpwith 1000 HR leaders sharing their views on apprenticeships. 

Despite being a valuable recruitment tool, the current system is just not working. If we are serious about#LevellingUp– levying up is a key way towards that.https://bit.ly/3JRpGg3

Our#LevyingUpreport revealed that 96% of UK businesses want to see change to the apprenticeship levy. 

Find out what business leaders think needs to happen to make the levy work more effectively. >https://bit.ly/3JRpGg3

@cityandguildscurrently have some excellent opportunities to join them as a moderator!

For more information visit:https://careers.cityandguilds.com/associate-vacancies/t-level-roles/…#Hiring#TLevels#Vacancy

@cityandguildshas identified training as the top driver for business growth. They also reveal that the majority of organisations will be investing more in training in the next 12 months.

Thanks to City & Guilds for these insights that help us shape our training landscape.

During an event with our President, HRH The Princess Royal, we showcased some of the innovative skills development our funding has enabled in prisons from:@the_bounce_back@HmpHull &@HMP_Humber@groundworkuk@HMPHighPoint&@IntertrainUK
@cityandguildshave developed qualifications that build brighter futures for#SkillsForWalesWatch the full case study video here:https://ow.ly/ptqv50OJ60q

Speaking at the event, our President HRH The Princess Royal, our CEO@K_DonnellyCEOand@HMPPentonvilleGovernor, Ian Blakeman, shared these thoughts on power of skills development to#changelivesand#reducereoffending.

@cityandguildsand EAL have been working with employers in the built environment sector across Wales to develop these qualifications so learners are more confident and workplace ready.

Access employer F&Qs and resources here:http://skillsforwales.wales/support/employers…

#LevyingUpshares the views of levying-paying employers across the UK, including great contributions from@5PercentClubUK@Impmister@xtraclimited@PwC_UK@LBGplc@breedongroup. 

Read their insights here:https://bit.ly/3JRpGg3

@cityandguildsunderstand the life changing links between skills development and social mobility and place social purpose at the heart of their efforts.

It was great to support their mission and pledge to champion the importance of skills for growth.

@cityandguildswill discuss strategies for integrating learning and skills development throughout the prison system, fostering an environment where more employers are encouraged to provide opportunities for ex-offenders. Be part of this transformative conversation at#Anthropy23

@cityandguildsare working to empower employers to broaden their recruitment horizons & break down barriers for individuals seeking access to the workforce. Their sessions will explore the changes necessary to create workplaces where everyone has a chance to contribute & thrive.

@cityandguildsare rolling out the next stage of its £1m Big Idea Fund, inviting expressions of interest from charities, prison governors, and training providers.

The goal is to support the reskilling of prisoners, ensuring they go on to lead rewarding and fulfilling lives

Pivotal role of skills training in the green economy transition.  How about city and guilds offer a solar and battery course so that their approved centres can play apart in delivering this skills training without having to apply to other exam bodies to work on this agenda?

As a independent provider of training and leaders in the field iMIT is. It right that our trainees have no access to funding- when they can get funding for courses that don’t deliver. Our occupational outcomes are excellent. Not tail wagging the dog#thepianotechnologyschool

I think the 8202 for electrical sucks. It holds back people who learn from hands on. Not everyone enjoys studying. Some people learn practically. You can learn testing and fault finding through someone showing you and doing over and over without going to college

My daughter still hasn’t received her her result as it has not been uploaded by you to UCAS putting her uni place and accommodation in jeopardy. I have called your call centre twice but they won’t tell me anything. The provider is trying to sort it but it’s totally unacceptable.

We're pleased that the Government recognised our ask in 2019 to allow SMEs to pool their funding for scale to increase their buying power and allow them to access high quality apprenticeship provision on the same terms as larger employers.#LevyingUpthe Chancellor's Budget
